title: tobornottob
author: tobornottob
content: I have several transactions stuck in the mempool through Sparrow. The Sparrow help forum from their Telegram thread asked me to go to sparrownodevalidator.com so that my server receptor can be updated.  This sounds odd. Does anyone have any experience with sparrow's node validator and updating their server like this?

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Stuck transaction due to mempool congestion or error broadcasting the transaction on sparrow wallet which of this is your problem? Because I don’t trust any telegram handle. If it is node issue you can easily choose to switch nodes from the wallet application no need to go to any unknown site that could expose your keys or privacy too much

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: It is similar to the Sparrow website: https://sparrowwallet.com/Avoid. Sparrow support replace-by-fee to increase the fee.It would be better to increase the fee of the last transaction until it is enough to get all the transactions confirmed.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: As mentioned above by Charles-Tim, you should avoid the website in question. That's a scam. If you have unconfirmed transaction, that's due to the low fee and nothing else. Are you the sender or the receiver? How much is the fee used for your transaction?If you are the sender and you are in a hurry, you can bump the fee.If you are the receiver and you in a hurry, you can do CPFP.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: With Sparrow wallet, you can use Replace by FeeHow do I increase the fee on a broadcasted transaction?[url]QuoteA transaction’s fee can be increased either by replacing it (RBF), or creating a child transaction (CPFP).To perform Replace by Fee (RBF), the transaction must:Be in the mempool (not yet confirmed)Have all inputs enabled for RBF (this is the default for transactions sent by Sparrow)Have all inputs from your walletIf all the above is true, then Sparrow will add a hover icon next to the transaction on the Transactions screen which looks like a hand with a cross above it. You can also right click to ‘Increase Fee’, which takes you to the Send screen with the transaction loaded, from where you can increase the fee (Sparrow may add another UTXO if there is insufficient change).You can also use CPFP by spending the outputs of the transaction at a higher fee rate.Replace by fee is helpful and you should always check that your broadcast transaction is RBF opt-in. It it is not opted in, you will not be able to use RBF to bump transaction fee later and you will have the only choice left, Child-Pay-For-Parents that are more expensive and harder to use for newbies.
